speaker: Dungeon Master & NPCs
lines: Griffin McElroy

speaker: Magnus Burnsides
lines: Travis McElroy

speaker: Merle Highchurch
lines: Clint McElroy

speaker: Taako
lines: Justin McElroy

speaker: Episode 7
lines: Moonlighting - Chapter One

speaker: Griffin
lines: Previously, on the Adventure Zone

speaker: Griffin
lines: Gundren is suddenly completely engulfed in flames. And Killian says,

speaker: Killian
lines: Time to go!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And she’s pointing at the center of town, at a well. The three of you dive into the well. As you look up through a small circle of light, all you see is flame above you. Just a—

speaker: Travis
lines: [Crosstalk] Well, tits.

speaker: Griffin
lines: A giant burst of flame. Phandalin’s gone. The entire town, where it used to be, you look around and all that you can see is black glass. A circle of black glass on the ground.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, this all sucks.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She suddenly looks over and sees the gauntlet again. She says,

speaker: Killian
lines: If you’ve already escaped the thrall of that thing, you can collect it. And we can take it somewhere where it will never do anything like this ever again.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You see a glass sphere, and a giant balloon pops out, basically a hot air balloon. One of those two moons in the night sky is getting much larger.

speaker: Taako
lines: [Surprised] Guys, the moon’s expanding!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And suddenly, you have gone into the moon. And Killian says,

speaker: Killian
lines: Well guys, hold onto your butts.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, I roll butt-holding. [Dice roll] Okay, 14. I’m holding my butt.

speaker: The Announcer
lines: What will our heroes find on the moon? I hope it’s not aliens because I’m afraid of those. It’s the Adventure Zone!

speaker: [Theme music
lines: Déjà Vu by Mort Garson]

speaker: Griffin
lines: The four of you, in your magic hot air balloon pod emerge into light. [Justin gasps dramatically] The light temporarily blinds the four of you, because, you know, you were just in a dark, dark tunnel for quite some time. But you emerge, and it’s bright, and as your eyes sort of adjust you get a good look at the room around you through the sort of glass exterior of this magic floating sphere.

speaker: Travis
lines: Paint us a word picture Griffin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Here goes!

speaker: Justin
lines: [Crosstalk] He’s trying to.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Nope! [Clint laughs] Let me reach into my... chest of ink, and here comes… the adjectives. [Travis snorts] I’m gonna unpack— [amused] I’m gonna unpack my adjectives. [Travis laughs]

speaker: Justin
lines: Remember, show, don’t tell. [Giggling continues]

speaker: Griffin
lines: You are in a dome-shaped room… almost has sort of an Epcot ball feel to it, if you can imagine what the interior of the Epcot ball— Do they ever let people inside that thing?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes. [Crosstalk] It’s called the Spaceship Earth.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Crosstalk] Inside of it is the World of Energy, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, well, imagine that.

speaker: Clint
lines: Is that where Figment lives?

speaker: Justin
lines: Nah, he lives in the world of imagination with Dreamcatcher.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Jokingly aggressive] Get your shit together, Clint.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Hey guys, guess what? This is the world of imagination. You’re in—

speaker: Clint
lines: A-HA!! HA HA! SO, SUCK IT!

speaker: Griffin
lines: One of the gerblins you killed—

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s a weird reaction to being in the world of imagination. [Laughing] But, all right.

speaker: Travis
lines: World of imagination, suck it!

speaker: Griffin
lines: One of the gerblins that you actually killed in the last chapter was was Figment. You didn’t even—

speaker: Travis
lines: [Laughing] Oh, no!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Maybe you should ask people’s names before you just slaughter them. So yeah, you’re in the interior of this dome-like structure. The exterior of the dome is sort of made out of these glowing triangles of glass. It’s a very ornate structure. And you get the impression that this is some sort of hangar for these balls that you just traveled in. And you see some people. You see people, all sort of dressed in blue and white soldiers’ garb. You see, on one end of the room there are some sort of holes in the floor that you think, you know, could be other tunnels. Mounted on top of those are these giant cannons. And you don’t see any, like, y’know, shells or cannonballs or anything like that but you see these big, big cannons on one end of the room. You realize that you have emerged on to, sort of a landing platform.

speaker: Travis
lines: Does there appear to be like, a gift shop? Or like, some kind of like restaurants in the terminal, or anything like that?

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Crosstalk] No, you think maybe it’s— maybe there’s, you know, another dome with a gift shop in it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, so like, dome B is where like Delta—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Maybe there’s a Dome Beta, and that’s where the Chili’s To Go is.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Loudly, shocked] Chili’s To Go is the words I was about to say with my mouth, and then you said ‘em, and I hate you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Amused] It’s the only other restaurant, other than Cinnabon, that exists in every airport.

speaker: Travis
lines: No, sometimes there’s Max and Erma’s.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s true.

speaker: Justin
lines: In an airport?

speaker: Justin
lines: I’ve never seen that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Loudly] Fantasy time! Fantasy time!

speaker: Travis
lines: Fantasy time! Fantasy Max and Erma’s. Magical Max— Miracle Max and Erma’s.

speaker: Justin
lines: Maxeth and Erma-eth!

speaker: Justin
lines: Ye Olde Max’s and Erma’s Tavern!

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Amused] Apothecary. [More serious] Okay. Killian taps on the wall of the glass sphere, and the hole that you guys boarded in opens up and she climbs out. And tr— entreats the three of you to follow her. She walks down a flight of stairs off the landing platform that you guys have emerged onto. And, as soon as you sort of cross the threshold of the sphere and place feet on solid earth— Well, kind of solid earth. Solid… moon? I dunno. The three of you get kinda dizzy. You get kinda nauseous and disoriented a little bit. Almost like the— as you look around and sort of take in your surroundings, the more you look around, the more you get a little lightheaded and foggy.

speaker: Travis
lines: We did survive the explosion in Phandalin, right? Like, this isn’t heaven, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ca— I— Yeah. Roma Downey reaches over and says “Surprise!” No.

speaker: Travis
lines: Griffin’s like “Surprise! I’m fake!”

speaker: Justin
lines: Griffin’s like the creators of Lost, and we immediately guess that this is purgatory and now he’s trying to cover it up by creating some other BS scenario about why it’s not purgatory.

speaker: Griffin
lines: But, spoiler alert, it’s purgatory.

speaker: Justin
lines: It is. Wait til the end. It is.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, so Killian, y’know, turns back and sees you sort of reeling as you descend the stairs, and says,

speaker: Killian
lines: Oh, by the way, things are going to be a little weird for a bit, but I promise that’s gonna pass.

speaker: Travis
lines: Just stick with your buddy, drink some orange juice.

speaker: Killian
lines: Yeah, take these, lie down, ‘cause you don’t want to faint on these stairs. That’ll be bad news bears. But I promise I’m gonna get you guys taken care of very quickly, I just need to run out and get you all authorized, really quick. It’ll take just a few minutes but please, just like, hang out here sit down take it easy, don’t over-exert yourselves and you’re gonna be just fine.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And she turns around and walks out of a door, from this dome-shaped hanger.

speaker: Travis
lines: So, do you guys wanna like, pop a squat? Just like, have a seat?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, I’ll just, let’s just chill.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, so we just sit down on the stairs. You know?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Cool.

speaker: Travis
lines: Take a minute to like, think about what has led us to this point in our lives.

speaker: Clint
lines: Wow.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. That would be good. Like, any backstory at all, would be—

speaker: Travis
lines: [Offended] I wrote out a four-page long backstory, you said it was too serious.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, dude, ‘cause it was, like, wicked mad serious.

speaker: Clint
lines: And listen, I want to tell you— somebody leaked it, because I’ve been getting all these tweets, “Wow, did ya see Magnus’s backstory?” How did that happen?

speaker: Travis
lines: I didn’t leak it.

speaker: Justin
lines: How did that get to the press, Travis?

speaker: Travis
lines: I did not leak it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: ‘Kay.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Mutters] I’m just sayin’…

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Skeptically] Someone hacked your internet.

speaker: Travis
lines: Might be somebody in my entourage.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Your posse. Okay. There are two guards sort of watching the door that Killian just walked through. And one of them turns and looks at you kind of sympathetically. The other one is unmoved. Imagine the what are they called? The Downton Abbey guards— No, wait. [Laughs] Downton Abbey’s not what it’s called. Those guards at the—

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s not a real place.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s not a real place, nor did they have guards!

speaker: Travis
lines: You know, where the Queen lives! At Downton Abbey!

speaker: Griffin
lines: One of these two very stoic guards turns and looks at you sort of sympathetically, and kind of waffles for a bit and then ultimately—

speaker: Travis
lines: He makes waffles?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He breaks his post and walks over to you guys and reaches into his jacket and pulls out a flask and hands it— just sort of holds it in your guys’ directions just like, “Here.” Hold on, let me come up with a voice for this guy. [Lower voice] “Here, uh” [normal voice] see, that’s just my voice, but lower.

speaker: Guard
lines: Here you guys should drink this. It’s— trust me, it’ll help.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Crosstalk, quickly] I’ll take it, I’ll take it. I’ll take it.

speaker: Guard
lines: Oh okay. Eager beaver.

speaker: Taako
lines: I hope this is Go-Gurt.

speaker: Guard
lines: It’s not, it’s brandy, but it’s uh, it’ll help.

speaker: Justin
lines: I tried it, and it is Go-Gurt.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, it’s—

speaker: Travis
lines: Roll for Go-Gurt.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, I—

speaker: Justin
lines: It’s a character choice I’m making, it’s definitely Go-Gurt.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Crosstalk] Okay, but see, the flask is not a character—

speaker: Travis
lines: [Crosstalk] Taako tastes Go-Gurt whenever he drinks libations.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Everything Taako drinks magically transmogrifier— that was the first spell Taako ever cast, and now it’s a terrible curse.

speaker: Justin
lines: And I can’t get it off! [Laughs]

speaker: Clint
lines: Go-Gurtation.

speaker: Taako
lines: Everything tastes like Go-Gurt, darling.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s a Sisyphean curse he thought it was going to be 24/7 Go-Gurt party, but no, he’s got like mad scurvy. Ok, so you—

speaker: Taako
lines: No, wait, I don’t, because it’s key lime Go-Gurt. So that’s fine. [Travis Read a book, Griffin.] On the scurvy front I’m cool. Read a book.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Are you passing the flask around? Are you hoarding it all to yourself?

speaker: Clint
lines: Don’t bogart that flask.

speaker: Taako
lines: Let me roll to see if I’m full. [Dice rolling] Yes, I’m full, I pass it over to… Magnus.

speaker: Travis
lines: I take a swig. It’s delicious.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It is delicious—

speaker: Guard
lines: That is delicious brandy, that’s from my hometown of Brand— Brandybu— Brandybuck.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I’m really glad you’re not from Phandalin.

speaker: Guard
lines: Why is that?

speaker: Magnus
lines: No reason, no reason.

speaker: Merle
lines: Oh, nothin’, nothin’!

speaker: Guard
lines: I’ve got a— I’ve got an uncle in Phandalin were you just there?

speaker: Taako
lines: Correction, darling, you had an uncle in Phandalin!

speaker: Guard
lines: Oh…

speaker: Magnus
lines: He was probably away on business, he’s probably fine.

speaker: Guard
lines: Well I didn’t— I mean, he wasn’t like my favorite uncle or anything, but… —

speaker: Magnus
lines: Good news!

speaker: Guard
lines: Okay.

speaker: Taako
lines: Great news!

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah, yeah! Just check with the executor of his will, I mean, just sayin’.

speaker: Travis
lines: Nope, the executor’s dead too.

speaker: Clint
lines: Aw!

speaker: Griffin
lines: As you guys swig this brandy, you find that the dizziness is sort of passing a little bit. You don’t know if you know, there is some sort of— if it’s neutralizing whatever was happening or if you’re just getting a little drunk, but it is helping out.

speaker: Merle
lines: None for me, none for me.

speaker: Guard
lines: Are you sure?

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah, I’m a cleric, I need to set an example for my coworkers.

speaker: Guard
lines: You’re Merle, right? I heard a rumor that you had 1,999 party points.

speaker: Merle
lines: Okay, alright, one little drink.

speaker: Guard
lines: No, listen, I don’t want to peer pressure you. If you don’t want it, that’s fine.

speaker: Travis
lines: Drink it.

speaker: Merle
lines: Most of those party points deal with piñatas.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. You drink it, and it just makes you, like, better than Magnus and Taako? You just, you are more sociable and more personable because of this, [Clint Oh, okay!] because of all the party points. He takes the flask back, and says,

speaker: Guard
lines: I know things are gonna be pretty confusing for a little while, I know that you’ve got the static-y stuff going on, I know that you’re kinda dizzy. And listen, every single person that you’re gonna meet up here, you know, went through the same thing, so don’t worry. Trust me, it’s gonna get a lot, a lot better really soon, and we’re all really really excited to have you.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [Aside] Do you guys know this guy?

speaker: Merle
lines: Taako, use your ways, get some information.

speaker: Guard
lines: Oh, sorry, my name is Avi.

speaker: Taako
lines: There you have it! [Laughter] He wasn’t going to say that, and I made him say that.

speaker: Merle
lines: Ah-fee?

speaker: Avi
lines: Avi. A-V-I, it’s uh, yeah. [Merle Ah. Weird.] It’s actually a very common name in Brandy…buck. I think Brandybuck might be a Lord of the Rings thing, but here we are.

speaker: Magnus
lines: No going back now!

speaker: Taako
lines: Certainly not to Phandalin!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says,

speaker: Avi
lines: After everything’s over, why don’t you guys come find me if you, you know, want to hang out or whatever. I like to—

speaker: Magnus
lines: We’ll bro out.

speaker: Avi
lines: Yeah, we can just, you know… lift some weights or something. Whatever you guys like to do. It’s all up to you. I like to lift some weights, so that’s why I suggested that.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [Crosstalk] That sounds totally great. We need a minute just to process everything that’s going on though, so like… [Crosstalk] I think we’re good.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Crosstalk] Just then, as soon as you say, “We need a minute just to process everything,” Killian comes back into the room and says,

speaker: Killian
lines: Okay, you guys are clear! Just follow me, and we can we can get this show on the road.

speaker: Travis
lines: Hold on.

speaker: Taako
lines: Bye, Ah-vee!

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, I follow her.

speaker: Avi
lines: Nice to meet you guys, you seem like real sweet dudes.

speaker: Taako
lines: Right on!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You walk out of the hangar, and see that indeed you are surrounded by more of these sort of dome-shaped buildings, these Epcot ball-esque buildings and they are of varying sizes? You’re standing on almost like a grassy field, it’s actually very lush, very well kept, better than you assumed some sort of secret moon base was capable of producing. And, [Crosstalk] as you look—

speaker: Travis
lines: [Laughs, crosstalk] This goes against everything I’ve ever thought about secret moon bases!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And as you—

speaker: Clint
lines: It’s got astroturf!

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, it’s real grass. It’s real— it’s nice stuff. It’s the best grass, that’s it. That’s all there is to it. [Laughter] This is—

speaker: Clint
lines: Well that explains Avi’s demeanor in there.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I reach— [bursts out laughing] It’s not—! You’re not walking on ganj!

speaker: Travis
lines: We walk into a field of weed!

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, it’s just really good grass. And I’m gonna put my word paintbrush away, now that I’ve reached the pinnacle.

speaker: Justin
lines: I think it’s starting to dry out a bit.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And as you look above you, you actually see the night sky. This is not some sort of covered installation; you can see the night sky. There’s only one moon above you presumably because you are on top of the other one? Which doesn’t exactly make sense quite yet. It’s not like a curved—

speaker: Justin
lines: Can I ask a question?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: As near as we can tell, is this moon— is the place we’re in, like, a façade? Or is it where we would have thought the other moon would have been? Like—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Why don’t you make a— you guys can make investigation checks if you wanna try and figure it out.

speaker: Travis
lines: I got a 9? Is investigation a skill? Yeah, I got a 9.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Taak-o? [With emphasis on the wrong syllable]

speaker: Griffin
lines: 19. yeah, just sort of judging by the area of this sort of base which is not, like, huge, right? It’s almost like about a football field? In diameter. It’s, you know, it’s not the area of a moon. So, yeah, you get the impression that whatever you just went through was some sort of façade, almost like this is some sort of like, I don’t know, whatever you’re standing on is behind a very elaborate prop, a very elaborate sort of set piece.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You don’t see the second moon in the sky anywhere though, so that’s about all that you can suss out with your investigation. Killian is leading you across this [laughing] quad, if you will, to a dome that is a little bit smaller, a little bit shallower than the other ones that you’re surrounded by. But it does have this sort of large spear sticking out of the top of it, almost like the— imagine, like, the Washington Monument coming out of the top of it. Only, this spear seems to be made of a completely translucent crystal, or perhaps also glass. A lot of glass up here. You get the impression that these people are into glass, and they’re into—

speaker: Clint
lines: And grass.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Glass, grass, and ass. Nobody rides on this—

speaker: Justin
lines: Everybody has a great, amazing ass.

speaker: Clint
lines: Nobody rides for free.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Everybody’s ass is amazing.

speaker: Travis
lines: Top notch.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Top notch.

speaker: Justin
lines: Are our ass— do I feel like my ass is better since I’ve been here?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, you actually feel worse about, sort of, your ass. Like, you don’t feel great about it, just standard. Your standard state, your baseline, is not like super proud of your own butt.

speaker: Justin
lines: Listen, if I don’t tell you there’s Go-Gurt in your flask, you don’t tell me how I feel about my hind end, okay?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright.

speaker: Justin
lines: Let’s just have some boundaries.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s a fine agreement. Killian is leading you into this dome with the spear sticking out of the top of it. She takes you inside, and there’s just sort of one thing in this room, and it’s a very large sort of column in the center of the room with doors on it, and she—

speaker: Travis
lines: Is it Zordon?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It is not Zordon, no. She rolls up her sleeve and takes out that bracer with the rune on it that I described to you guys in the last installment that she used to summon the glass sphere. And the door seems to react to it and opens up into what looks like an elevator car, and Killian says,

speaker: Killian
lines: I can’t actually go with you guys down there. It’s sort of high-security, but yeah, this is where you need to go next.

speaker: Travis
lines: We do that.

speaker: Clint
lines: [In a smooth announcer voice] Attention fan artists, Killian’s bracer might be a wonderful suggestion.

speaker: Griffin
lines: There’s actually been a lot of Killian fanart. She has become a beloved character. Much more so, I would actually say, than the three of you. And I get it.

speaker: Travis
lines: We’re gonna have to do a spin-off.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, The Killian Mysteries.

speaker: Justin
lines: Killin’ It.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Killin’ It with Killian. You three step onto the elevator, and you actually hear the doors to this dome open up once more, and you hear a guy go,

speaker: Guy
lines: [With a mopey voice] Uh, can you hold the elevator please? Can you hold the elevator?

speaker: Clint
lines: [In a similar voice] Not your doorman.

speaker: Guy
lines: Can you hold the elevator please?

speaker: Travis
lines: I start jamming on the button for the door close real quick, like “c’mon, c’mon.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, the door’s—

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, we hold the door.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Guy
lines: Thanks, guys.

speaker: Griffin
lines: This half-elf man who is dressed in sort of silly colorful clothing. He’s wearing he’s not really wearing the standard-issue uniform that you’ve seen from the people walking around this campus. He is wearing some a bard’s garb if you will. Feathered cap and everything, pantaloons, billowing pantaloons. [Justin giggles] He has a violin sort of strapped to his back— a fiddle, actually, strapped to his back. He’s carrying a few rolls of parchment onto the elevator with you, and he says,

speaker: Guy
lines: Okay, can you press the button now?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah?

speaker: Guy
lines: Guess we’re goin' to the ground floor.

speaker: Taako
lines: No problem. Do you do you work here?

speaker: Guy
lines: Yeah. What gave it away? Was it the fact that I’m, like, here? No, no, man, I’m, no I just— I got lost and I ended up on a moon base. [short pause] I’m just kidding.

speaker: Magnus
lines: That’s a good kid.

speaker: Taako
lines: No, no, it’s funny.

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Magnus
lines: That was solid.

speaker: Taako
lines: No, ‘cause we’re here, and we don’t work here, so we just… thought… or, I dunno.

speaker: Guy
lines: Oh, are you guys initiates or whatever? [Unenthusiastic] That’s cool.

speaker: Taako
lines: [Uncertain] Yeaaaaaahhh, yeah… initiates…

speaker: Travis
lines: Sure. I hit the button.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The elevator doors close and you start to descend. This bard looks very sullen. He looks very bummed out. If his voice didn’t give it away, this is not what you’d typically call a happy person.

speaker: Travis
lines: I tickle him.

speaker: Guy
lines: [Glumly] Okay. [With no change in tone] Hee hee hee hee hee hee hee— Stop.

speaker: Guy
lines: Stop. Stop. Hee hee hee.

speaker: Clint
lines: Can we have him sound like Michael Bolton?

speaker: Griffin
lines: [In a monotone voice] This what he sound— That’s what Michael Bolton sounds like when he talks.

speaker: Clint
lines: That’s what I thought.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Monotone] You just— you don’t hear it ‘cause he’s always singing. If Michael—

speaker: Travis
lines: I tickle him again.

speaker: Guy
lines: Hee hee hee hee. Stop it for— Stop it, seriously.

speaker: Travis
lines: He pees a little bit.

speaker: Guy
lines: No, I don’t.

speaker: Merle
lines: May I ask your name? Garb bard— barded garber?

speaker: Travis
lines: Nailed it.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Imitating the guy] It’s Victor Garber.

speaker: Guy
lines: My name is Johann.

speaker: Merle
lines: Ah.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay.

speaker: Johann
lines: What’s— what do you guys—?

speaker: Magnus
lines: What’s wrong, dude?

speaker: Taako
lines: What seems to be bothering you?

speaker: Johann
lines: [Sighs] Everything, I guess. If you think about it, just sort of like, where I ended up. Like, my life choices and—

speaker: Magnus
lines: You’re on a moon! That’s pretty great.

speaker: Taako
lines: [Excited] Yeah! You’re a bard!

speaker: Johann
lines: [Sighs] I guess that’s true, I mean I don’t get a lot of customers. The problem is, fellas, if I’m going to be frank with you—

speaker: [Travis and Justin both try to say “I thought your name was Johann!”]
Johann
lines: [Tired] Yeah. Good one, assholes.

speaker: Taako
lines: Well, mine wasn’t a joke. I’m an idiot.

speaker: Merle
lines: [Encouraging] Go ahead, bud, tell us what’s on your mind. What’s bothering you?

speaker: Taako
lines: What’s eatin’ ya, Johann?

speaker: Johann
lines: I’m, uh… I’m like the greatest violinist basically ever.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh, okay.

speaker: Johann
lines: I mean, I don’t see any point in being like, humble about it. I don’t wanna lie to you guys, I’m basically like the best violinist ever. But nobody’s ever gonna know who I am and that— I dunno, it just gets to me sometimes, you know?

speaker: Travis

You can sort of make out the shadow of something from this under-lighting. But you can’t really get your eyes to focus on whatever this thing is. You hear some sort of whale sounds, if you will, which puts the three of you in the mood, for reasons that you don’t really understand. lines: There goes another great composition.

lines: And you see the parchment float up into the tank. You can’t seem to— you knew that this was the most beautiful song you’ve ever heard and you would never forget it, but you can’t seem to remember the melody. You can’t seem to remember that moment at all. You remember that this guy played music for you, but when you try to remember the music itself, the— that memory just isn’t there anymore. Which is very sad.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, can you hear us Justin? [Pause] No. Okay, that was a test. Travis. Your mind… reels. You immediately remember the music, and you are moved, and you are grateful. But with each passing second, you remember more and more. You remember Killian telling you, in the mine, asking if you’re there for the Phoenix Fire Gauntlet. You remember the Black Spider asking you if you were members of the Bureau of Balance. You remember beyond that, you remember months and months and years beyond that. You remember a war that destroyed entire towns, you remember bloodshed, you remember, vaguely, you remember just this… carnage and conflict that seems too enormous for you to have possibly forgotten. You lost loved ones in this war, you lost a lot of people you know. It was a time of great turmoil, and you remember it. You don’t remember, the particulars, but you remember it, And you look up, and you see in the tank, clear as day…

lines: Almost like Zordon, but not at all this giant, almost like, jellyfish, with enormous, like, it is the size of a whale, but jellyfish-shaped, with thousands of tendrils reaching off its body. And inside of its body, you can almost make out, like, a galaxy, like a swirling nebula of stars and constellations—

lines: A nature check? To try and discern what kind of animal this is?

speaker: Justin
lines: I mean, I wouldn’t know whether or not I should use arcana or not. I do want a nature check, but—

speaker: Travis
lines: Ditto, I rolled 17. So just decide what it needs to be, and that’s what I rolled for.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Laughing] No sir, that’s not how we play Dungeons & Dragons.

speaker: Travis
lines: But I rolled the dice!

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s not how we play Dungeons & Dragons!

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s an 8.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, so I have an 18 in arcana, which is like magical type things I would kno— like, sort of how much I know about magical crap.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Whatever this… effect was… alchemy is a school of magic, right, that involves sort of potions and unguents, and formulas and stuff like that. So it wasn’t that, and it wasn’t… whatever this was, you get the impression that it wasn’t… magical. No magic here.

speaker: Justin
lines: Hmm.

speaker: Travis
lines: Alright, well I got a 17 investigation check, is what I was rolling.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mmkay! With that investigation check, you sort of discern that… everything that has sort of come to your guys’ minds are memories. And not new information, if that makes sense. You didn’t— if you will, you didn’t learn anything. You just, just sort of remembered.

speaker: Travis
lines: So we, so the world that we live in lived through a terrible war, in which many people died, and then it was just erased from the consciousness of the people.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, from us.

speaker: Justin
lines: Well from us, at least, certainly. Griffin, I got a 21 in nature.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Yeah, I mean this thing looks like a jellyfish, but I mean, jellyfish—

speaker: Travis
lines: But it kisses like a man!

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s, I mean it’s the size of a whale and it’s got like a like stars and shit floating inside of it. So that’s not typical for jellyfish behavior.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay. You heard when I said 21, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay. Just wanted to make sure.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Johann sort of looks— eyes the three of you, sees that you’ve finished sort of digesting this ichor, and says,

speaker: Johann
lines: You guys… you guys good?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, yeah, super great.

speaker: Johann
lines: Uh… Bureau of Balance— did you guys hear that? No, no static—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, we got that goin’.

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Bureau of Balance.

speaker: Merle
lines: Bureau of Balance.

speaker: Johann
lines: Sweet, sweet, sweet. Cool. Well—

speaker: Clint
lines: Do we remember him?

speaker: Merle
lines: Do we remember you, Johann?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No. You don’t— I mean, you didn’t forget him—

speaker: Justin
lines: From 30 seconds ago, but other than that…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Right.

speaker: Travis
lines: We’ve not met him before.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You never forgot him. Yeah, you’ve just met him today. He says,

speaker: Johann
lines: Cool. Well welcome to the… welcome to the club, I guess. Uhm… thanks for taking the red pill, right?

speaker: Magnus
lines: What?

speaker: Johann
lines: Nevermind. So, yeah—

speaker: Justin
lines: And we instantly remember The Matrix.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You remember the first one, you don’t want to remember the second and third ones.

speaker: Travis
lines: Griffin, does the jellyfish creature seem to be like responsive, or acknowledging us in any way? Or is it just there, livin’ its own life, like, separate from the world?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah it’s floating, it’s moving— it’s not like stationary or dead but it’s not like, it doesn’t have eyeballs to look at you; it’s not holding up a sign saying like “Ha ha you guys just drank my shit,” like—

speaker: Clint
lines: [Laughter] Well, we did.

speaker: Justin
lines: Trav, I wouldn’t grill Griffin too much on it, ’cause I got a 21 in nature, and what I learned from that is that it’s a giant jellyfish and jellyfish aren’t usually giant and don’t normally have stars in them.

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s what my— So what this— This is more of a rough sketch right now.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay well I clearly recognize this is a special thing; Magnus bows before it, just out of deference and respect.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, a—

speaker: Clint
lines: And ass-kissing.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Johann says,

speaker: Johann
lines: Wait, what are you doing? What are you—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Bowing to your weird jellyfish god.

speaker: Johann
lines: Are you bowing?

speaker: Johann
lines: It’s not a god. At least, I don’t think so. None of us really know.

speaker: Magnus
lines: You don’t know shit, Johann.

speaker: Johann
lines: We don’t, that’s, I mean, you’re not a hundred percent wrong. So this thing is the we call it the voidfish. That’s not, like, I mean, that’s probably not its real name.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Did you guys, like, take a long time to come up with that one?

speaker: Johann
lines: I actually spun that one just sort of straight off the dome, and it just kind of stuck.

speaker: Merle
lines: Is it because it’s been voiding into that water we just drank?

speaker: Johann
lines: No. I mean, yeah. But that’s not why it’s called that. Yeah, we— I mean, it’s the only one, like, ever. So. Those kinds of things typically don’t get named, so we just sort of stuck with voidfish, and, it’s pretty cool. If you feed it— it feeds on information, and then whatever information you give it, it just sort of… removes from, well, from existence. It just sort of stops existing, unless you’ve been inoculated and “drank from the tank” is what we say down [Travis giggles] here in the gamekeeping department.

speaker: Magnus
lines: So that’s why Johann’s so bummed out. ‘Cause he has to write these songs, and then let the voidfish consume them.

speaker: Johann
lines: Yeah, that’s sort of my job here, to keep this thing fat and happy, ‘cause man, if it dies, we’re all fucked. So, yeah, I write these compositions and feed him—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Why?

speaker: Johann
lines: Why?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yes, why? What serv— Aside from letting people drink its poop, what service is it providing?

speaker: Johann
lines: It might be— hold on, it might be its pee.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Aside from letting people drink its waste—

speaker: Johann
lines: It’s not all pee. There’s, like, water and stuff in there too. It’s not just floating around in its own waste. Look at this beautiful goddamn jellyfish. You think this thing is just like a— some sort of poop weirdo?

speaker: Magnus
lines: So, but what does it do?

speaker: Johann
lines: It makes— It destroys information. It just sort of obliviates—

speaker: Taako (in Justin voice)
lines: But what happens if it— what would happen if it died?

speaker: Johann
lines: Then everyone would remember. And that would be—

speaker: Magnus
lines: And that would be bad.

speaker: Johann
lines: Guys, you’re gonna learn a lot of stuff here in the next, like, 20 minutes or so. And if all of that— If everyone down there knew that— Well, I mean they used to, and that’s what caused—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay, super cool, Johann. Who’s in charge, here?

speaker: Johann
lines: That’s the Director. Now— now that you guys have been inoculated, she’ll probably want to see you.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Could you take us to her?

speaker: Johann
lines: I’m not, I mean, I’m not the valet here. I’m the gamekeeper, but—

speaker: Travis
lines: I slip him five bucks.

speaker: Johann
lines: [Sarcastic] Oh, oh, thank you, sir! [Laughter] Oh, wow, five whole dollars!

speaker: Travis
lines: And there’s more where that came from.

speaker: Justin
lines: Can I just double-check on Travis inventing paper currency? Like, that’s…

speaker: Clint
lines: [Laughs] Hey, put that in the little chute there.

speaker: Griffin
lines: They’re actually Magnus-bucks.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s a special currency—

speaker: Travis
lines: Good at any Magnus location! Not to be used in association with any other Magnus coupons.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He points you back towards the elevator and says,

speaker: Johann
lines: Ask one of the guards and they’ll get you there.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay, thanks.

speaker: Johann
lines: Can I just say, though, it’s like nice to meet you guys.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [Laughing] Super great meeting you too, Johann.

speaker: Merle
lines: And let me tell you, Johann. I think that of all the people we’ve met here, you are the [static] one of all.

speaker: Johann
lines: No. That’s not how it works.

speaker: Merle
lines: I’m just messing with you!

speaker: Travis
lines: Roll to see if Johann finds that funny.

speaker: Johann
lines: But it wasn’t, like, a good joke. ‘Cause, like those typically make sense—

speaker: Travis
lines: I said, roll.

speaker: Merle
lines: Give me a break, I’ve still got fish poop taste in my mouth.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He rolled a— Oh, my god, the d20 landed on an edge! We’ll never know.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, he points towards the door and says,

speaker: Johann
lines: That way. There you go.

speaker: Travis
lines: I tickle him.

speaker: Johann
lines: Oh, god.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He doesn’t let you. He actually slaps your hand out of the way, with a very deft strike.

speaker: Travis
lines: But we both have kind of a winking, like—

speaker: Johann
lines: Don’t you fu— no.

speaker: Travis
lines: Like, “ah, that’s good. Remember when we did that before?” ‘Cause we remember now.

speaker: Johann
lines: It wasn’t nice to meet you. I take that one back. You two are cool, though.

speaker: Travis
lines: I slip him another fiver.

speaker: Johann
lines: Thank you. What can I spend these on, though?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Magnus merchandise—

speaker: Clint
lines: [Crosstalk] Only at Chuck E. Cheese.

speaker: Magnus
lines: The Magnus experience.

speaker: Johann
lines: What’s that?

speaker: Magnus
lines: What’s the Magnus experience?

speaker: Johann
lines: Yeah, walk me through it, step-by-step.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Well, basically you go through this animatronic house that’s set up, and you get to feel what it’s like to have a day in the life of Magnus.

speaker: Justin
lines: Like Dolly Parton’s Dollywood!

speaker: Travis
lines: Exactly.

speaker: Justin
lines: Travel to the Appalachian home, in which she learned her craft!

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s narrated by Hal Holbrook.

speaker: Johann
lines: Is there a room—

speaker: Clint
lines: [Speaking with a deep, narrator-style voice] When Magnus started out, he was just a young warrior.

speaker: Johann
lines: Is there— Are you going to have to now build a room onto the Magnus Experience that involves customers who pay to go through the Magnus Experience drinking a vial of shit?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Correct.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, remember—

speaker: Magnus
lines: The Magnus Experience is ever-evolving. Every time you go back, you’re never going to have the same trip twice.

speaker: Justin
lines: You know, that’s true. Debra and the kids wanted to go back. I said “We just went there in June.” We went back, it was almost completely the same, but the gift shop was different. There were new items.

speaker: Magnus
lines: And coming this winter, we have a Harry Potter Experience.

speaker: Johann
lines: Harry wha— Oh, yeah, him. Anyway, get lost, all right? I’ve got stuff to do.

speaker: Justin
lines: I get lost.

speaker: Clint
lines: Get Lost!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, he points you back towards the elevator. And as you make your way through, the doors open, and a very old man, a human man, walks out. And he’s wearing very just sort of a plain brown robe. He’s got sort of a tonsure haircut. And he is also carrying a roll of parchment, and you hear Johann yell out

speaker: Johann
lines: Come on in, let’s let’s get this over with. I hate— This is my least favorite part.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And the sort of old monk-looking man walks by you with the parchment. if you guys want to try and make a perception check to see what’s going on on this parchment…

speaker: Clint
lines: I already know who he is. I know who he is.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You do?

speaker: Clint
lines: He walks by and he says [imitates Obi-Wan in Star Wars] “the force will be with you, always.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, that wasn’t—

speaker: Travis
lines: I got an 18. Nope, sorry, a 17. I have -1. 17.

speaker: Clint
lines: I got an 18.

speaker: Griffin
lines: 22. You can actually see this parchment, you see a familiar name on it. You see the name Magic Brian, and you see “Age 121. Drow. Male. Six foot one.” You see basically a stat sheet with information on Magic Brian. Those basic stats are basically—

speaker: Travis
lines: His likes, his dislikes—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, the monk sort of brushes past you a little bit too quickly for you—

speaker: Travis
lines: [Crosstalk] His bra size.

speaker: Griffin
lines: For you to get into what really turned him on, when he was among the living.

speaker: Clint
lines: Magic Brian likes long walks on the beach and soft gentle kisses.

speaker: Griffin
lines: But this monk walks by with this rap sheet on Magic Brian and walks through the heavily guarded door, which swings shut, leaving the three of you in the hallway to the elevator.

speaker: Travis
lines: Are we the only ones in the hallway? Are there guards there?

speaker: Griffin
lines: The guards, the 14 guards are still there.

speaker: Trav
lines: I say,

speaker: Magnus
lines: Hello, would any of you fancy gentleman care to help us find the director?

speaker: Guard
lines: [In a weird voice] I will!

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, there isn’t anybody who sounds like that. One of the guards walks out and beckons towards you onto the elevator, and puts his bracer to the door and it opens up.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Sweet bracer, dude.

speaker: Guard
lines: Thanks. You’re gonna get your own here in a bit. You guys inoculated?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah. Yeah, we’ve been inoculated.

speaker: Guard
lines: Well, can I ask you a question—

speaker: Magnus
lines: We believe in vaccinations.

speaker: Guard
lines: What did you guys think it tasted like? ‘Cause I don’t— I think it tastes kinda like of kind of like crab rangoon, a little bit.

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah, that, yeah.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, yeah I see that. I can see that. Mine was kind of like—

speaker: Guard
lines: Had sort of a creamy consistency, but it definitely sort of had that like fresh seafood taste to it.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, I would say it was more of, like a, like a salmon roe kind of thing, you know?

speaker: Guard
lines: Oh, yeah, I could get that too.

speaker: Merle
lines: With a soupçon of poop.

speaker: Magnus
lines: You know, we discussed if it was a poop or pee thing. Maybe it was the jellyfish sperm?

speaker: Guard
lines: There’s any kind of— any number of fluids that you could’ve just imbibed. Anyways, see ya.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he puts his bracer against the panel, and the elevator closes, sending you upward, back onto the campus.

speaker: Clint
lines: And I think it’s a relevator.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, you’re the worst.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You fuck up once— I talk for four hours when we do these things, and you fuck up one word and all of a sudden Griffin’s the asshole! Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Thanks for the support, Dad, in front of our millions of fans, my dad.

speaker: Clint
lines: I’ll be here all week.
